VariableDescription.Header:
#  WARNING: No Data Selected for this Time Period. 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         GOES
#     SOURCE_NAME                     G11>Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite (GOES-11)
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       L2>Level 2 data
#     DESCRIPTOR                      MAG>Fluxgate magnetometer
#     DATA_VERSION                    0
#     PI_NAME                         Howard J. Singer
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center
#     TEXT                            Satellite positions and velocities derived from SSCWEB GEI ephemeris, interpolated                     
#     TEXT                             to one minute time resolution; perpendicular vectors for ENP coordinate system                        
#     TEXT                             derived from pos X vel. B field vectors in LH-ENP and GEI systems, B field                            
#     TEXT                             total magnitude, magnetotorquer counts, and data quality flags derived from                           
#     TEXT                             512 msec binary GOES data files.  General Comments from Dr. Howard J. Singer                          
#                                      (GOES Magnetometer PI).                                                                               
#                                     1. Data Description: A full description of the GOES magnetometer data, including                       
#                                      use of the quality flags and torquer current information, is contained in a                           
#                                      GOES 8-12 Magnetometer Readme File prepared by Dr. Howard J. Singer. The GOES                         
#                                      data have been prepared at NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) by Dr.                         
#                                      Howard J. Singer with major data processing and data evaluation contributions                         
#                                      by SWPC staff, Lorne Matheson and Ann Newman, as well as coordinate transformation                    
#                                      development by Dr. Paul Loto aniu (University of Colorado/SWPC).                                      
#                                     2. Coordinate description for PEN: Hp:  magnetic field vector component, points                        
#                                      northward, perpendicular to orbit plane which for a zero degree inclination                           
#                                      orbit is parallel to Earth's spin axis. .He:  magnetic field vector component,                        
#                                      perpendicular to Hp and Hn and points earthward. Hn:  magnetic field vector                           
#                                      component, perpendicular to Hp and He and points eastward. Ht:  total field.                          
#                                     3. Magnetometer offsets and noise:.GOES 8-12 spacecraft are 3-axis stabilized.                         
#                                      There is only one opportunity for a spin maneuver at the beginning of the mission                     
#                                      to determine on-orbit magnetic field offsets. There are additional complications                      
#                                      that result from needing to know the changing offsets introduced by torquer                           
#                                      coils on the satellites. While comparisons of GOES data to model fields during                        
#                                      quiet times and comparisons to nearby encounters with other spacecraft are                            
#                                      used to demonstrate the observed data values are reasonable, caution should                           
#                                      be used in assigning absolute accuracy. While there has been a significant                            
#                                      effort to remove the effects of torquer coil interference in the 0.512 s data,                        
#                                      there can be small, typically less than 1 nT spikes in the data at the time                           
#                                      of torquer current changes. More information on this topic is included the                            
#                                      more extensive readme file.  This file is a living document that will be updated                      
#                                      periodically.                                                                                         
#                                     4.  Orbital Inclination: During the primary operational lifetime of the GOES                           
#                                      satellites, the satellite inclination is typically kept within a few tenths                           
#                                      of a degree of 0 degrees inclination; however, as the satellite ages, the inclination                 
#                                      can grow to several degrees.                                                                          
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   GOES
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  g11_l2_mag
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 g11_l2_mag_00000000_v00
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      GOES-11 High Resolution Magnetometer data vectors (at 512 ms, ephem at 60 sec)
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 512 ms (science), 60 sec (ephemeris)
#     RULES_OF_USE                    Open Data for Scientific Use
#     GENERATED_BY                    THEMIS SOC
#     ACKNOWLEDGEMENT                 NASA Contract NAS5-02099
#     MODS                            Rev- 2008-11-03
#     ADID_REF                        NSSD0110
#     LINK_TEXT                       GOES 8-12 draft magnetometer README file
#                                     GOES magnetometer data
#                                     GOES general information
#                                     VMO product description for
#     LINK_TITLE                      THEMIS web server
#                                     THEMIS web server
#                                     NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center
#                                     GOES11 512ms magnetometer data
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://themis.ssl.berkeley.edu/data/goes/GOES8-12_readme_draft090108.doc
#                                     http://themis.ssl.berkeley.edu/data/goes/
#                                     http://www.swpc.noaa.gov/Data/goes.html
#                                     http://vmo.nasa.gov/vxo/metadata.php?id=spase://VMO/NumericalData/GOES11/MAG/PT0.512S                  
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor

#

#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         GOES
#     SOURCE_NAME                     G11>Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite (GOES-11)
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       L2>Level 2 data
#     DESCRIPTOR                      MAG>Fluxgate magnetometer
#     DATA_VERSION                    0
#     PI_NAME                         Howard J. Singer
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center
#     TEXT                            Satellite positions and velocities derived from SSCWEB GEI ephemeris, interpolated                     
#     TEXT                             to one minute time resolution; perpendicular vectors for ENP coordinate system                        
#     TEXT                             derived from pos X vel. B field vectors in LH-ENP and GEI systems, B field                            
#     TEXT                             total magnitude, magnetotorquer counts, and data quality flags derived from                           
#     TEXT                             512 msec binary GOES data files.  General Comments from Dr. Howard J. Singer                          
#                                      (GOES Magnetometer PI).                                                                               
#                                     1. Data Description: A full description of the GOES magnetometer data, including                       
#                                      use of the quality flags and torquer current information, is contained in a                           
#                                      GOES 8-12 Magnetometer Readme File prepared by Dr. Howard J. Singer. The GOES                         
#                                      data have been prepared at NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) by Dr.                         
#                                      Howard J. Singer with major data processing and data evaluation contributions                         
#                                      by SWPC staff, Lorne Matheson and Ann Newman, as well as coordinate transformation                    
#                                      development by Dr. Paul Loto aniu (University of Colorado/SWPC).                                      
#                                     2. Coordinate description for PEN: Hp:  magnetic field vector component, points                        
#                                      northward, perpendicular to orbit plane which for a zero degree inclination                           
#                                      orbit is parallel to Earth's spin axis. .He:  magnetic field vector component,                        
#                                      perpendicular to Hp and Hn and points earthward. Hn:  magnetic field vector                           
#                                      component, perpendicular to Hp and He and points eastward. Ht:  total field.                          
#                                     3. Magnetometer offsets and noise:.GOES 8-12 spacecraft are 3-axis stabilized.                         
#                                      There is only one opportunity for a spin maneuver at the beginning of the mission                     
#                                      to determine on-orbit magnetic field offsets. There are additional complications                      
#                                      that result from needing to know the changing offsets introduced by torquer                           
#                                      coils on the satellites. While comparisons of GOES data to model fields during                        
#                                      quiet times and comparisons to nearby encounters with other spacecraft are                            
#                                      used to demonstrate the observed data values are reasonable, caution should                           
#                                      be used in assigning absolute accuracy. While there has been a significant                            
#                                      effort to remove the effects of torquer coil interference in the 0.512 s data,                        
#                                      there can be small, typically less than 1 nT spikes in the data at the time                           
#                                      of torquer current changes. More information on this topic is included the                            
#                                      more extensive readme file.  This file is a living document that will be updated                      
#                                      periodically.

VariableDescription.Name: g11_b_tot
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         GOES
#     SOURCE_NAME                     G11>Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite (GOES-11)
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Magnetospheric Science
#     DATA_TYPE                       L2>Level 2 data
#     DESCRIPTOR                      MAG>Fluxgate magnetometer
#     DATA_VERSION                    0
#     PI_NAME                         Howard J. Singer
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center
#     TEXT                            Satellite positions and velocities derived from SSCWEB GEI ephemeris, interpolated                     
#     TEXT                             to one minute time resolution; perpendicular vectors for ENP coordinate system                        
#     TEXT                             derived from pos X vel. B field vectors in LH-ENP and GEI systems, B field                            
#     TEXT                             total magnitude, magnetotorquer counts, and data quality flags derived from                           
#     TEXT                             512 msec binary GOES data files.  General Comments from Dr. Howard J. Singer                          
#                                      (GOES Magnetometer PI).                                                                               
#                                     1. Data Description: A full description of the GOES magnetometer data, including                       
#                                      use of the quality flags and torquer current information, is contained in a                           
#                                      GOES 8-12 Magnetometer Readme File prepared by Dr. Howard J. Singer. The GOES                         
#                                      data have been prepared at NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center (SWPC) by Dr.                         
#                                      Howard J. Singer with major data processing and data evaluation contributions                         
#                                      by SWPC staff, Lorne Matheson and Ann Newman, as well as coordinate transformation                    
#                                      development by Dr. Paul Loto aniu (University of Colorado/SWPC).                                      
#                                     2. Coordinate description for PEN: Hp:  magnetic field vector component, points                        
#                                      northward, perpendicular to orbit plane which for a zero degree inclination                           
#                                      orbit is parallel to Earth's spin axis. .He:  magnetic field vector component,                        
#                                      perpendicular to Hp and Hn and points earthward. Hn:  magnetic field vector                           
#                                      component, perpendicular to Hp and He and points eastward. Ht:  total field.                          
#                                     3. Magnetometer offsets and noise:.GOES 8-12 spacecraft are 3-axis stabilized.                         
#                                      There is only one opportunity for a spin maneuver at the beginning of the mission                     
#                                      to determine on-orbit magnetic field offsets. There are additional complications                      
#                                      that result from needing to know the changing offsets introduced by torquer                           
#                                      coils on the satellites. While comparisons of GOES data to model fields during                        
#                                      quiet times and comparisons to nearby encounters with other spacecraft are                            
#                                      used to demonstrate the observed data values are reasonable, caution should                           
#                                      be used in assigning absolute accuracy. While there has been a significant                            
#                                      effort to remove the effects of torquer coil interference in the 0.512 s data,                        
#                                      there can be small, typically less than 1 nT spikes in the data at the time                           
#                                      of torquer current changes. More information on this topic is included the                            
#                                      more extensive readme file.  This file is a living document that will be updated                      
#                                      periodically.                                                                                         
#                                     4.  Orbital Inclination: During the primary operational lifetime of the GOES                           
#                                      satellites, the satellite inclination is typically kept within a few tenths                           
#                                      of a degree of 0 degrees inclination; however, as the satellite ages, the inclination                 
#                                      can grow to several degrees.

#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   GOES

#                                     GOES magnetometer data
#                                     GOES general information

#                                     THEMIS web server
